title: We Might Be Getting More 'Game Of Thrones' After All
text:
HBO Programming Director Says Season 8 Could Be Longer © HBO HBO Programming Director Says Season 8 Could Be Longer Trending News: We Might Be Getting More 'Game Of Thrones' After All Shares Long Story Short 
HBO Programming President Casey Bloys said they haven't decided how long Game of Thrones will go for. Long Story 
There was devastation across the seven kingdoms (continents) when Game of Thrones showrunners David Benioff and Dan Weiss said that the show will only be around for two more shortened seasons . Sadly, just two 7/8-episode seasons would remain for Jon Snow, Dany and the White Walkers, the showrunners said last July. 
But you can wipe those tears because there might be hope for more. 
HBO Programming President Casey Bloys told Entertainment Weekly that the network hasn't made a final decision about how much GoT will remain. 
“They’re still figuring out the shape of the season, what they want to do,” Bloys said of Benioff and Weiss. “I’ll take as many as they want to do. If they give me eight, I’ll want 10. But it’s really up to them. They’ll let me know.” 
via GIPHY 
Speaking like a true businessman. 
Bloys also discussed the possibility of a sequel or prequel, something the showrunners haven't been too hot about . 
“It’s such a big property we would be foolish not to explore it, but it’s a pretty high bar,” he said. “We’ll take some shots at it. I’m not going to do it just to do it. It has to feel very special. I would rather have no sequel and leave it as-is then have something we rushed out.” 
More GoT would obviously be great, but there's nothing worse than a show going on longer than it should. Plus, with no George R.R. Martin book to draw from (he said Winds of Winter might be out in 2017 , but we'll believe it when we see it), that's putting a lot of faith in HBO to maintain the show's excellent plot . 
You'll be able to see Season 7, however long it is, this summer. Own The Conversation Ask The Big Question
